meanings.definition: To make a sudden attack on an enemy by troops or other armed forces.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were raiding the enemy camp at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The pirates were raiding the merchant ships for treasure.
meanings.sent3: The kids were raiding the cookie jar before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The storm was raiding the coastline with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The band of thieves was raiding the wealthy neighborhood for valuables.

meanings.definition: To enter a place and steal things.
meanings.sent1: The burglars were raiding the house for valuable items.
meanings.sent2: The raccoons were raiding the garbage cans for food scraps.
meanings.sent3: The students were raiding the vending machine for snacks during break time.
meanings.sent4: The wind was raiding through the open window, scattering papers around the room.
meanings.sent5: The ants were raiding the picnic blanket for crumbs left behind.

meanings.definition: To search a place for something in a hurried and careless way.
meanings.sent1: The detective was raiding the suspect's apartment for clues.
meanings.sent2: The kids were raiding the house for their lost toys.
meanings.sent3: The chef was raiding the pantry for ingredients to make a last-minute dish.
meanings.sent4: The wind was raiding through the trees, causing leaves to scatter everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The shoppers were raiding the clearance section for discounted items.
